Comment: This command info is generated from fig
Name: emacs
Description: An extensible, customizable, free/libre text editor — and more

Arguments.Name: --batch
Arguments.Description: Do not do interactive display; implies -q

Arguments.Name: --daemon
Arguments.Description: Start a server in the background

Arguments.Name: --fg-daemon
Arguments.Description: Start a server in the foreground

Arguments.Name: --version
Arguments.Description: Display Emacs version information and exit

Arguments.Name: -q
Arguments.Description: Do not load an init file

Arguments.Name: --no-site-file
Arguments.Description: Do not load the site-wide startup file

Arguments.Name: --no-desktop
Arguments.Description: Do not load a saved desktop

Arguments.Name: -Q
Arguments.Description: Similar to "-q --no-site-file --no-splash",  Also, avoid processing X resources

Arguments.Name: --no-splash
Arguments.Description: Do not display a splash screen during start-u

Arguments.Name: --debug-init
Arguments.Description: Enable Emacs Lisp debugger during the processing of the user init file ~/.emacs.  This is useful for debugging problems in the init file

Arguments.Name: -t
Arguments.Description: Use specified file as the terminal instead of using stdin/stdout.  This must be the first argument specified in the command line

Arguments.Name: --file
Arguments.Description: The same as specifying file directly as an argument
